agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Ways & Means TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Wednesday, April 10, 2019 PLACE: JHR 140 CHAIR: Rep. Dustin Burrows HB 457 Thompson, Ed | et al. Relating to the use of tax revenue by certain municipalities for the payment of certain hotel-related bonds or other obligations. HB 533 Stephenson | et al. Relating to the authority of certain municipalities to pledge certain tax revenue for the payment of obligations related to hotel projects. HB 1195 King, Tracy O. Relating to the use of municipal hotel occupancy tax revenue in certain municipalities. HB 1197 Button Relating to the allocation of hotel occupancy tax revenue collected by certain municipalities. HB 1259 Paul Relating to the authority of certain municipalities to pledge certain tax revenue for the payment of obligations related to hotel projects. HB 1557 Springer Relating to the authority of a municipality to pledge certain tax revenue for the payment of obligations related to hotel projects. HB 1633 Kuempel Relating to the authority of certain counties to impose a hotel occupancy tax. HB 1634 Kuempel Relating to the authority of certain counties to impose a hotel occupancy tax. HB 1813 Thompson, Ed Relating to the use of tax revenue by certain municipalities for the payment of certain hotel-related bonds or other obligations. HB 2199 King, Tracy O. Relating to the use of municipal hotel occupancy tax revenue in certain municipalities. HB 2272 Guillen Relating to the county hotel occupancy tax rate in certain counties. HB 2293 Perez Relating to the authority of certain municipalities to pledge certain tax revenue for the payment of obligations related to hotel projects. HB 2358 Guillen Relating to the administration and collection of sales and use taxes applicable to certain sales. HB 2407 Krause | et al. Relating to the authority of a municipality to pledge certain tax revenue for the payment of obligations related to hotel projects. HB 2647 Morrison Relating to the allocation of certain state hotel occupancy tax revenue. HB 2788 Paul Relating to the use of hotel occupancy tax revenue by certain municipalities, including the authority to pledge certain revenue for the payment of obligations related to hotel projects. HB 2959 Springer Relating to the authority of certain counties to impose a hotel occupancy tax. HB 3036 Biedermann Relating to the authority of certain municipalities to pledge certain tax revenue for the payment of obligations related to hotel projects. HB 3197 Landgraf Relating to the use of municipal hotel occupancy tax revenue in certain municipalities. HB 3437 Murr Relating to the authority of certain municipalities to pledge certain tax revenue for the payment of obligations related to hotel projects. HB 3497 Bell, Cecil Relating to the authority of certain municipalities to pledge certain tax revenue for the payment of obligations related to hotel projects. HB 4032 Guillen Relating to the permitting and taxation of certain boats and boat motors; imposing a fee. HB 4042 Lucio III Relating to the municipal hotel occupancy tax. HB 4102 Sanford Relating to the use of tax revenue by certain municipalities for the payment of certain hotel-related bonds or other obligations. HB 4152 Nevárez Relating to use of hotel occupancy tax be certain counties. HB 4158 Zwiener Relating to the use of municipal hotel occupancy tax revenue in certain municipalities. HB 4203 Canales Relating to the use of municipal hotel occupancy tax revenue by certain municipalities. HB 4228 Nevárez Relating to the use of municipal hotel occupancy tax revenue in certain municipalities. HB 4347 Anchia Relating to the use of certain tax revenue by certain municipalities for the payment of job training programs and the development of hotel and convention center projects. HB 4524 Bonnen, Greg Relating to the authority of certain municipalities to pledge certain tax revenue for the payment of obligations related to multipurpose convention center facility projects. HB 4542 Guillen Relating to reports by persons involved in the manufacture and distribution of alcoholic beverages for purposes of sales and use taxes. Bills added after last posting: HB 4347 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
